posts.title: EU retaliates against Trump's trade moves and slaps tariffs on produce from Republican states
top_comments:
Just to be clear, the tariffs are on all US imports but happen to be hitting a number of red states.  Goods from blue states will be affected as well.  

>The EU duties aim for pressure points in the U.S. while minimizing additional damage to Europe. The tariffs — taxes on imports — primarily target Republican-held states, hitting soybeans in House Speaker Mike Johnson’s Louisiana, and also beef and poultry in Kansas and Nebraska. Produce in Alabama, Georgia and Virginia is also on the list.

Virginia has voted consistently blue in presidential elections and while the governor is Republican, the state house is Dem.  And yes I am aware of the NoVA-southern VA demographics but I doubt the EU cares whether Arlington voted for Trump or not.

> The EU duties aim for pressure points in the U.S. while minimizing additional damage to Europe. The tariffs — taxes on imports — primarily target Republican-held states, hitting soybeans in House Speaker Mike Johnson's Louisiana, and also beef and poultry in Kansas and Nebraska. Produce in Alabama, Georgia and Virginia is also on the list.

The current administration is trying to bully our long-standing allies, and anyone in our country who doesn't comply with them. I'm not shocked the world is starting to fight back.
The bourbon industry is not going to have a good time.  They weren't too happy when Canada took their products out of provincially controlled stores.
Imagine being Putin and planning for this day for so long and finally seeing it come together.
Cut to 24 hours later when Trump puts a hold on the EU tariffs.

Minnesota is a blue state but all the farm areas are red as hell.  Good hit those soybeans, I have no more empthany for those people.

They themselves benefit from these programs and then talk about how great Christie Noem is from South Dakota.  GO FUCKING MOVE THERE THEN (yeah i know she's not the gov now)

posts.title: French nuclear attack submarine docked in Halifax, Canada
top_comments:
Excellent. 

Perhaps we could get British nuclear attack subs based here permanently since we are still a part of the Commonwealth.
It's nuclear powered, it doesn't have nuclear warheads. And this happens this time of year.
Halifax being about 600 km from St Pierre et Miquelon, a territorial overseas collectivity of France.

they definitely worded that headline in a very specific way to garner views, which is nothing new, but this seems to be a pretty extreme case. “Let’s use the public’s fear of a nuclear attack as a way to engage readers!” This is a standard operation for this submarine and it’s being used to further fuel fears of WW3. 

“Nuclear attack submarine” is not common terminology. “Nuclear-powered attack submarine” is typically the description. I know it’s pedantic but at a glance (which is how most folks read headlines), one could easily assume a nuclear attack had occurred in France.
Getting harder and harder to hate the French ffs

So former submariner here, for every docked foreign submarine you see, there’s more patrolling our national waters unseen. A French submarine docked in Canada shouldn’t be making the news when there’s likely 3-4 Russian submarines within spitting distance of the US east coast.
Clearly a baguette class submarine
This is not nearly as big a deal as some people think.
I hope it stays there until trump is out of office

I love the French.

Macron should request that the U.S. return the Statue of Liberty since "they arent using it" anymore.

posts.title: Brittany Holberg, inmate on Texas death row for 27 years, has her conviction tossed by federal appeals court
top_comments: Holy hell. How do you recover from losing all that time. I’m sure Texas has some laws limiting restitution to some embarrassingly small amount.

The conviction relied on the testimony of a jailhouse informant who recanted in 2011, but the Texas appeals court and the federal district court decided that this key testimony basically being a lie wasn't enough to overturn the conviction.

>In securing her conviction in 1998, Randall County prosecutors heavily relied on testimony from a jail inmate who was working as a confidential informant for the City of Amarillo police. That informant recanted her testimony in 2011, but neither a Texas Court of Criminal Appeals or a federal district court found that prosecutors had violated Holberg’s constitutional right to a fair trial.

Seems shady, but consider

>During trial, Holberg asserted that she acted in self-defense and that she stabbed Towery because she feared for her life and sought to protect herself after he struck her on the back of the head and refused to relent.

>“The jury was presented with graphic physical evidence that Holberg sadistically butchered a sick old man-with a lamp rammed down his throat as the coup de grâce,” Duncan wrote. “That evidence doomed Holberg’s self-defense theory and there is no chance that impeaching Kirkpatrick would have resurrected it.”

Self defense does not usually include having a lamp shoved down your throat. I’m inclined to not lean too heavily on that tainted testimony. Would I say it’s first degree murder? No. But it was murder, or manslaughter at the very least. Time served does seem appropriate.

I'm not inclined to believe any "jailhouse confession" revealed by another inmate. I'm supposed to believe that a person in jail decided to confess to a crime to someone they just met? And I'm supposed to believe this other person already in jail is somehow an honest person and should be believed; and that they're not getting some kind of benefit for their testimony? No thanks.

What I don't understand is that in this case, the nature of the murder was clearly not completely self-defense. It seems like they could have gotten a conviction anyway, so I don't understand why they decided they needed this tainted testimony other than they wanted to get a death penalty conviction for personal reasons.
She was let off on a technicality. After reading the article, I really doubt she was actually innocent. How does a lamp get shoved down somebody's throat in self-defense?
And imagine if at any time during those 27 years it was her turn. Disgusting. This is why the death penalty needs to be abolished
She owes the Dept of Corrections money bc she wasn’t entitled to all that free room and board.  -Texas prosecutors

It is incredibly difficult to get a conviction overturned.

#never talk to a cop sans lawyer… cops don’t want justice they just want to close the case
Honestly I'm surprised anyone bothered to pay attention to a sex worker's case. Good for her.

I’m of two minds on this, there was definitely legal malpractice here and that should be rectified but I also don’t think she’s innocent.
 I don’t know what the right answer is but we can’t  have a system where the state ignores the rules because then were all in jeopardy.

posts.title: Mom missing for 6 days found alive stranded in car: 'She had given up hope'
top_comments: So thankful someone found her in time. Something similar happened to my coworker’s husband some years ago. They were relocating to a new state for a job. Husband was the last to travel alone after closing up the old house. He was driving through a mountainous area and veered off the road. His car landed in a very wooded area many feet below the highway and not visible. He was pinned hanging upside down and could not get down or out of the car. Couldn’t reach the phone and the battery eventually died. Authorities were reluctant to do deep search because he had not been missing 24 hours. They said he could have stopped off to eat or rest. She reached out to friends and family and anyone who would help. They were able to narrow down the search area on the basis of his last conversation with his wife. The only reason they finally found him was a bright red dolly fell out of his truck during the accident and the handle was sticking out of a visible area. This is why you should always let someone know of your travel plans and check in once in a while and keep your phone charged.
Johnny Martinez is the man who saw her from atop a large tractor. An incredible stroke of luck that he saw her and to quickly take action. What a hero.

>She was stuck in the car and could not get out. But she was able to reach the water from the car, Caldwell said. The only way she was able to survive was using her hoodie and dipping it into the water in a ditch and sucking the water, or bringing the water into her mouth from the ditch.

Wow. What a strong and smart woman. It's shocking how often this happens.

>Vanderwall said Martinez could spot the car because he was driving a tall tractor.

>"I myself had traveled that road at least three to four times since she crashed and did not see her," Vanderwall noted.

That's some serious luck right there, or just fate.

>Cassell had been trapped since Thursday night when she fell asleep at the wheel and veered off the road into a deep ditch under a bridge, according to her father, Delmar Caldwell.

Please don't drive tired. If you're sleepy, find a place to stop and make a phone call to someone to let them know where you stopped.

Years ago my mom and dad were volunteer EMTs in Indiana. They responded to a call of an accident found after several days in an overgrown ditch. The driver had maggots in his wounds but was alert. Occasionally, this happens in Indiana.
"Everybody that helped to find her and the volunteers and everything ... it was a wonderful miracle,"  Good to hear some good news .

>"She was stuck in the car and could not get out. But she was able to reach the water from the car,".  
    
I wish they had more details, or even a picture. I’m trying to imagine the situation.
Our phones track us and share our locations all the time. Is there no reason the phone company couldn't have shared her last known point with investigators?
Whoa…Amazing how she improvised getting water in her system an effort to live

posts.title: EPA administrator announces huge rollback of environmental regulations
top_comments: Why does he look like a slightly older Mark Zuckerberg?
So now we're going to have more cancer in addition to everything else.  MAGA is MAGA-ing for sure.
Looks like PFAs, microplastics and other various chemicals are back on the Menu! And drinking water too!

Do these MAGA idiots not understand that they also live in the same environment that we do, they drink the same water we do and breathe the same air we do? And when it’s all polluted and dirty, they get just as sick?
Immensely disheartening, though not surprising

Promising to drive “a dagger through the heart of climate-change religion,” Environmental Protection Agency Administrator Lee Zeldin on Wednesday outlined plans for an aggressive rollback of environmental regulations.

In a Wall Street Journal opinion piece and an EPA news release, Zeldin announced that he intends to reconsider more than a dozen core EPA rules and regulations, including those pertaining to emissions standards for vehicles, pollution from power plants and the finding that provides the scientific basis for addressing climate change. 

“Today marks the death of the Green New Scam,” Zeldin wrote in The Wall Street Journal, arguing that his deregulation plan would create an environment where “businesses can thrive and infrastructure can be built.” He added that he wants to reassess rules that, in his view, “throttled oil and gas production and unfairly targeted coal-fired power plants,” and suggested that his proposed actions would roll back “trillions of dollars in regulatory costs.” 

The EPA announced that it will revisit water pollution limits for coal plants, air quality standards for small particles and the mandatory reporting of greenhouse gas emissions by large emitters like oil and gas companies, among other rules. 

Zeldin also signaled that the EPA would consider upending its own endangerment finding, a 2009 legal decision that says greenhouse gases like carbon dioxide and methane are warming the Earth and that warming presents a threat to public health and welfare. The finding is the lynchpin for the agency’s regulations about greenhouse gas pollution under the Clean Air Act.
"Sure, we destroyed the climate and thus the world.  But for those last few years we really created a lot of shareholder value"
So when is enough enough? When do we actually stand up and do something?
This is comic-book villain shit right here.
These cunts are evil and subhuman.

posts.title: Victims identified in Mississippi medical helicopter crash
top_comments:
My wife is a doctor (family medicine, Primary Care physician) she did her residency at UMMC. 

This is tragic news. I don't think she ever knew any of the pilots personally, but she saw them all the time when she did her hospital rotations coming in and out. I remember her saying they took their job very seriously and always looked like a "military unit" when they would pack up and run to the helipad.

Living in Jackson MS, by UMMC I'd see/ hear the helicopter take off and land frequently. If I remember correctly you can see one of the landing pads right off of I-55. The pessimist in me always had intrusive thoughts of "it would suck if that helicopter ever crashed". I feel shame ever having that thought.

We have friends who are still living in Jackson MS who also work at UMMC, they have been posting non-stop about this.

I’m curious what kind of information the German secret service has for them to be 80-90% sure it’s a lab leak, because that’s…pretty damn high, and I don’t think there’s as much reason to distrust the German government TBH, but how does that jive with the genomic data? 

I hate how political this has become because obviously it’s important to know where it came from in order to prevent future outbreaks. I feel like every few months we get an article that says with high confidence that it came from bats or from a lab. Of course the complete opacity of the Chinese government doesn’t help with this at all. 

It’s also important to remember that we may not have the answer for some time. For example we still don’t know the specific source of Ebola even though it was first discovered over 40 years ago.

I still think that “investigations” that claim it’s a lab leak are more concerned with politics than actually determining the source of the virus and how the reduce the possibility of another virus mutating and becoming a worldwide pandemic (essentially inevitable now).

Yall... read the article. THEN go read the actual paper this conclusion is based on. 

The paper is from 2020. It has been pretty throughly debunked. Many times. 

No new information has been released. It's just a clickbait article. It's definitely not the "gotcha" people want it to be.

Why even put this out, if it is low confidence?


The Vikings will win the superbowl next year.  


Eventhough I have low confidence with that declaration you should bet your life savings on it.
Crazy how saying this back in 2021 would paint you as a wacko conspiracy theorist.
And the propaganda machine revs up

posts.title: French nuclear attack submarine docked in Halifax, Canada
top_comments:
Excellent. 

Perhaps we could get British nuclear attack subs based here permanently since we are still a part of the Commonwealth.
It's nuclear powered, it doesn't have nuclear warheads. And this happens this time of year.
Halifax being about 600 km from St Pierre et Miquelon, a territorial overseas collectivity of France.

they definitely worded that headline in a very specific way to garner views, which is nothing new, but this seems to be a pretty extreme case. “Let’s use the public’s fear of a nuclear attack as a way to engage readers!” This is a standard operation for this submarine and it’s being used to further fuel fears of WW3. 

“Nuclear attack submarine” is not common terminology. “Nuclear-powered attack submarine” is typically the description. I know it’s pedantic but at a glance (which is how most folks read headlines), one could easily assume a nuclear attack had occurred in France.
Getting harder and harder to hate the French ffs

So former submariner here, for every docked foreign submarine you see, there’s more patrolling our national waters unseen. A French submarine docked in Canada shouldn’t be making the news when there’s likely 3-4 Russian submarines within spitting distance of the US east coast.
Clearly a baguette class submarine
This is not nearly as big a deal as some people think.
I hope it stays there until trump is out of office

I love the French.

posts.title: EU retaliates against Trump's trade moves and slaps tariffs on produce from Republican states
top_comments:
Just to be clear, the tariffs are on all US imports but happen to be hitting a number of red states.  Goods from blue states will be affected as well.  

>The EU duties aim for pressure points in the U.S. while minimizing additional damage to Europe. The tariffs — taxes on imports — primarily target Republican-held states, hitting soybeans in House Speaker Mike Johnson’s Louisiana, and also beef and poultry in Kansas and Nebraska. Produce in Alabama, Georgia and Virginia is also on the list.

Virginia has voted consistently blue in presidential elections and while the governor is Republican, the state house is Dem.  And yes I am aware of the NoVA-southern VA demographics but I doubt the EU cares whether Arlington voted for Trump or not.

posts.title: Mom missing for 6 days found alive stranded in car: 'She had given up hope'
top_comments: So thankful someone found her in time. Something similar happened to my coworker’s husband some years ago. They were relocating to a new state for a job. Husband was the last to travel alone after closing up the old house. He was driving through a mountainous area and veered off the road. His car landed in a very wooded area many feet below the highway and not visible. He was pinned hanging upside down and could not get down or out of the car. Couldn’t reach the phone and the battery eventually died. Authorities were reluctant to do deep search because he had not been missing 24 hours. They said he could have stopped off to eat or rest. She reached out to friends and family and anyone who would help. They were able to narrow down the search area on the basis of his last conversation with his wife. The only reason they finally found him was a bright red dolly fell out of his truck during the accident and the handle was sticking out of a visible area. This is why you should always let someone know of your travel plans and check in once in a while and keep your phone charged.
Johnny Martinez is the man who saw her from atop a large tractor. An incredible stroke of luck that he saw her and to quickly take action. What a hero.

>She was stuck in the car and could not get out. But she was able to reach the water from the car, Caldwell said. The only way she was able to survive was using her hoodie and dipping it into the water in a ditch and sucking the water, or bringing the water into her mouth from the ditch.

Wow. What a strong and smart woman. It's shocking how often this happens.

>Vanderwall said Martinez could spot the car because he was driving a tall tractor.

>"I myself had traveled that road at least three to four times since she crashed and did not see her," Vanderwall noted.

That's some serious luck right there, or just fate.

>Cassell had been trapped since Thursday night when she fell asleep at the wheel and veered off the road into a deep ditch under a bridge, according to her father, Delmar Caldwell.

Please don't drive tired. If you're sleepy, find a place to stop and make a phone call to someone to let them know where you stopped.

Years ago my mom and dad were volunteer EMTs in Indiana. They responded to a call of an accident found after several days in an overgrown ditch. The driver had maggots in his wounds but was alert. Occasionally, this happens in Indiana.
"Everybody that helped to find her and the volunteers and everything ... it was a wonderful miracle,"  Good to hear some good news .

>"She was stuck in the car and could not get out. But she was able to reach the water from the car,".  
    
I wish they had more details, or even a picture. I’m trying to imagine the situation.
Our phones track us and share our locations all the time. Is there no reason the phone company couldn't have shared her last known point with investigators?
Whoa…Amazing how she improvised getting water in her system an effort to live
